file_insights.description: Updated two skeleton grid layouts to use responsive breakpoints instead of fixed column counts

patterns_discovered.description: Using Material-UI sx prop with responsive object syntax for gridTemplateColumns
patterns_discovered.benefit: Single column layout on mobile, multi-column on desktop

patterns_discovered.description: Responsive loading states for skeleton loaders maintaining consistent mobile-first approach
patterns_discovered.context: Applied to both header cards (3-column) and content cards (2-column) layouts

patterns_discovered.description: Base layout is single column (xs) with expansion to multi-column at md breakpoint

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Skeleton loading states should match final content grid structure
gotchas_discovered.impact: Mismatched skeleton grids can cause layout shifts during content loading
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Keep skeleton and content grid responsiveness in sync

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Material-UI responsive syntax requires object notation in sx prop
gotchas_discovered.impact: String-based grid columns won't support breakpoints
gotchas_discovered.resolution: Use object syntax with breakpoint keys for responsive values

approach_outcome.consistency: Applied same responsive pattern to both grid layouts

recommendations.recommendation: Test responsive skeleton rendering at xs, sm, md, lg breakpoints
recommendations.rationale: Ensure layout transitions are smooth and skeleton proportions match content

recommendations.recommendation: Audit all other skeleton loaders in the application for responsive patterns
recommendations.rationale: Apply same responsive breakpoint strategy across similar loading states

recommendations.recommendation: Consider extracting responsive grid configuration to a reusable constant
recommendations.rationale: Reduce duplication of gridTemplateColumns responsive objects

recommendations.recommendation: Document the responsive breakpoint strategy used for skeleton loaders
recommendations.rationale: Ensure future developers maintain consistent responsive patterns
